CatDescriptText: Mr. Frank Robinson, 5379 Warble Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 10, 1958, pg. A2, with question: "Do you think that Negroes display any racial prejudice towards each other?"  Answer reads: "I don't think so because they are too busy trying to earn a living and therefore they do not have time to discriminate against each other.  Most of the time is devoted to church activities."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Frank Robinson holding coat and standing on Liberty Avenue, Downtown
